posts.cooked: I haven‚Äôt sent a personal email in almost three years.

posts.name: Talya (she/her)
posts.cooked: i often communicate with my landlord over email, as well as with certain doctors. i‚Äôve had recent communications with companies regarding certain services over email, and i reached out to several artists about certain things over email. i don‚Äôt use email when i can IM a person, but whenever i can‚Äôt email still presents a useful option.
Communicating at work and with my kids‚Äô school teachers is very common.

posts.name: üëäüá∫üá∏üî•
posts.cooked: That‚Äôs interesting! In both the doctor and landlord cases, I do everything through a web portal.

posts.name: üëäüá∫üá∏üî•
posts.cooked:
Should‚Äôve specified personal use, but I‚Äôm in a rare position of not using email for much at work. It‚Äôs almost all via Slack. And I don‚Äôt have kids, so no communicating with schools.

I know from other people at work that email for kids‚Äô school stuff is pretty frequent, which would make me crazy .
I do use email for a lot of things, work related mostly. My last ‚Äòpersonal email‚Äô was today.
Oh, some utility bills are also sent via email. Often email is the method used when turning off ‚Äúpaper-free billing‚Äù.

Other than work (school) where we regularly count 30-40 emails per day, most of which are human-to-human, and other than the uses mentioned in the OP‚Äôs post title, I also use email to communicate with various customer support departments, lawyers, and extra-curricular activity people (e.g. a dance association I am part of).

Utility companies send bills, insurance companies send documents, my calendar sends reminders, and I also receive 3 or 4 newsletters, some daily and the others weekly (which is all I have time for).

Overall, still a great part of life.
Nowadays, seldom except for types of items mentioned. Only occasionally I‚Äôll communicate with an actual person by email.
I still find email very useful for mailing lists, for example, but also for newsletters.

And then getting your email being shared by others without permission.

Hide my email (iCloud+) is a great feature for that.
posts.edit_reason: Automatically removed quote of whole previous post.

posts.cooked: I assume you meant preventing your email address from being shared. I was confused at first and thought you meant preventing your email messages from being shared.
Yea, my English isn‚Äôt Englishing today due to reasons.

posts.name: Stefaan Huysentruyt
posts.cooked: Sure, but I use end-to-end encrypted email when possible. I use Proton Mail, which is, given protected by Swiss law is by far the safest provider at the moment.

shlangis:

I use Proton Mail

I did this too, until out of nowhere my account was deleted. Three years of (important) emails gone.

posts.cooked: Did they give any kind of a reason for it? Maybe I should check what accounts are hooked up to Protonmail so I can add backup emails to those accounts.

Most likely due to the inactivity policy:

Proton

Inactive accounts | Proton

If you have a Proton Free plan, you must log in and use any Proton service once a year to maintain your account. Learn more.
Never got any notification, so it‚Äôs really weird that I lost all my emails.
